oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Labor Day Weekend Bluegrass Festival in Point South (19083)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Bluegrass music; Music festivals; Monroe, James; Wade, Willis; Metal photoplates;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Two color window card (red and black on brown) announcing a Labor Day Weekend Bluegrass Festival featuring James Monroe and the Midnight Ramblers, Mary Ann Walker, L.W. Lambert and Blue River Boys, Willis Wade, Harry Brendle and the Virginia Pardners, Paul and Peggy Holt, the Dixie Dewdrops, Bluegrass Kats, and more in Point South on September 4 and 5. Poster features metal photoplates of James Monroe, Mary Ann Walker, Willis Wade, and Harry Brendle. To see the business record associated with this poster, visit https://digi.countrymusichalloffame.org/digital/collection/hatch3/id/50219/
